Cashier Job at J3 Foods and Store International




        
    

        
        J3 Foods and Store International is an FMCG distributor. We have been in existence over 8 years. J3 has branches in several locations; Lagos, Ibadan, Ogun, Ondo, and Osun state.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Iyana Ipaja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Customer Experience Cashier is responsible for processing transactions efficiently while delivering excellent customer service, promoting repeat sales, and supporting the sales and operations teams.
	The role goes beyond traditional cashiering to include customer relationship building, upselling, after-sales engagement, and contributing to overall outlet performance.


Key Responsibilities
Cashiering and Transaction Management:


	Promptly generate accurate sales invoices based on order details.
	Handle cash, POS, and bank transfer payments.
	Verify payment evidence (transfers, receipts, teller slips) for correctness (amount, reference, account details).
	Forward all payment documentation to the Accounts Officer/Accountant for confirmation.
	Follow up to ensure timely payment confirmations.
	Notify the relevant department (e.g., warehouse) once payments are approved for release.
	Maintain accurate records of all invoices and receipts.
	Ensure all transaction activities align with internal financial policies.
	Submit daily/weekly transaction reports to the Accounts department.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / NCE / HND qualifications, with 1 - 4 years of work experience.


Salary
N80,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: j3foodsandstores.hr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Established in 2014, ARCO Worldwide Services Ltd. (AWS) is a wholly owned Nigerian company providing advanced security and drone solutions. Job Position: Human Resources Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers

Job Summary


	The Human Resources Supervisor will assist the Human Resources Manager in overseeing HR functions within Arco Aviation Academy, a subsidiary of Arco Worldwide Services Limited.
	Responsibilities include recruitment, employee relations, training and development, and ensuring compliance with labor laws and company policies.
	The role is instrumental in supporting the growth and development of the academy&rsquo;s team, promoting a positive work culture, and ensuring that HR strategies align with the operational objectives of the academy.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the recruitment process for various roles within the organization, including drafting job descriptions, posting vacancies, and screening candidates.
	Coordinate interviews, assessments, and selection processes for academic and other support staff.
	Handle the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring they are integrated smoothly into the company&rsquo;s operations and culture.
	Act as the first point of contact for employee queries and HR-related concerns.
	Supports the HR Manager to foster a positive workplace environment by addressing employee grievances and resolving conflicts in a timely and professional manner.
	Conduct regular check-ins with staff to ensure engagement and address any concerns.
	Support the implementation of performance evaluation processes, ensuring that employees receive regular feedback and development opportunities.
	Assists the HRM to work with department heads to develop key performance indicators (KPIs) and ensure performance reviews are conducted consistently.
	Assist in identifying training and development needs and create tailored programs to support employee growth.
	Collaborate with department heads to support continuous professional development initiatives for operational teams.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including contracts, certifications, and performance documents.
	Handle payroll inputs, leave management, and attendance tracking.
	Ensure compliance with local labor laws, aviation-specific regulations, and company policies, particularly those related to UAV academic operations.
	Support the operations team in managing compliance with aviation labor regulations related to UAV academic and other support staff.
	Monitor the development of employees and ensure that training records are up to date.
	Manage employee benefits programs, such as health insurance, pensions, and allowances.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	4 - 6 years of experience in an HR role, preferably within the aviation academic sector.

	Strong knowledge of HR best practices and employment legislation.
	Experience with recruitment, onboarding, and performance management systems.

	Proficiency in HR software and tools (e.g., HRIS, ATS).

	Office-based role with occasional travel to field or operational sites to support HR activities.
	Flexibility in working hours may be required to meet operational needs, especially during peak recruitment or project times.

	Support the implementation of performance evaluation processes, ensuring that employees receive regular feedback and development opportunities.
	Assists the HRM to work with department heads to develop key performance indicators (KPIs) and ensure performance reviews are conducted consistently.
	Assist in identifying training and development needs and create tailored programs to support employee growth.
	Collaborate with department heads to support continuous professional development initiatives for operational teams.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including contracts, certifications, and performance documents.
	Handle payroll inputs, leave management, and attendance tracking.
	Ensure compliance with local labor laws, aviation-specific regulations, and company policies, particularly those related to UAV academic operations.

	Monitor the development of employees and ensure that training records are up to date.
	Manage employee benefits programs, such as health insurance, pensions, and allowances.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	4 - 6 years of experience in an HR role, preferably within the aviation academic sector.
	HR Certification is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of HR best practices and employment legislation.
	Experience with recruitment, onboarding, and performance management systems.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Desired Competencies:
	Familiarity with aviation academy regulations and the specific HR needs of operations personnel.
	Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
	Proficiency in HR software and tools (e.g., HRIS, ATS).


Working Conditions:


	Office-based role with occasional travel to field or operational sites to support HR activities.
	Flexibility in working hours may be required to meet operational needs, especially during peak recruitment or project times.

Head of Compliance and Internal Control Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited - Our client, a Microfinance Bank, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Compliance and Internal Control

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Head of compliance and Internal Control you will ensure adherence to all regulatory requirements, strengthening the internal control environment, and leading the Bank’s Know Your Customer (KYC), Anti-Money Laundering (AML), and Electronic Fund Transfer (EFT) compliance initiatives.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Lead the design and implementation of internal control systems across all operational areas of the Bank
	Ensure timely rendition of all statutory and regulatory returns to relevant bodies including the CBN, NDIC, and FIU
	Monitor regulatory updates and changes, and ensure timely and effective communication and implementation within the Bank
	Oversee the Bank’s KYC, AML/CFT, and transaction monitoring programs
	Provide guidance and training to staff on compliance and control-related matters
	Coordinate with internal and external auditors during audits, examinations, and inspections


Requirements


	B.Sc or HND in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in accounting and internal control functions, within the financial services or microfinance sector is required.
	Additional certification such as Microfinance Certified Professional (MCP) will be an added advantage
	Strong knowledge of CBN regulatory framework, KYC, AML/CFT, and statutory reporting
	Excellent analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Salary
N450,000 - N500,000 Monthly.

Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Customer Retention Executive is responsible for developing and overseeing initiatives to improve customer retention, loyalty, and satisfaction across all ORÍKÌ touchpoints.
	This role will manage customer engagement strategies, supervise the Customer Retention Officer, analyze retention data, and collaborate cross-functionally to ensure exceptional customer experience that drives repeat business and long-term loyalty.


Responsibilities
Retention Strategy & Execution:


	Develop and execute strategic initiatives to improve customer loyalty, reduce churn, and increase repeat purchases.
	Monitor customer behavior trends and design personalized engagement plans to re-engage inactive customers.
	Lead the implementation of retention campaigns in partnership with the Marketing and Customer Service teams.


Team Supervision:


	Supervise and guide the Customer Retention Officer, ensuring proper follow-ups and prompt resolution of issues.
	Set performance goals for the officer and track results regularly.


Customer Feedback Collection:


	Gather and analyze customer feedback to identify areas for improvement in the customer experience.
	Share feedback with the relevant departments to improve products, services, or processes.


Customer Engagement & Follow-Up:


	Proactively contact customers via phone, email, or other channels to follow up on their experience, ensuring satisfaction and addressing any concerns.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, ensuring continued engagement with the brand.


Issue Resolution & Problem Solving:


	Address and resolve customer complaints or dissatisfaction, ensuring that issues are handled promptly and professionally.
	Proactively identify potential problems before they escalate, working with customers to find solutions.


Data Management & Customer Record Keeping:


	Keep accurate records of customer interactions, updates, and follow-up tasks in the CRM system.
	Regularly update customer profiles, ensuring data is accurate and current to enable effective follow-up.


Collaboration & Cross-Functional Collaboration:


	Work closely with sales, marketing, and customer service teams to align on customer retention initiatives and provide insights based on customer feedback.
	Collaborate with other departments to ensure a seamless customer experience and increase satisfaction across touchpoints.


Upselling & Cross Selling:


	Identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling based on customer behavior and past purchases, ensuring that these offerings are aligned with customer needs.
	Provide customers with relevant product or service recommendations to enhance their experience with the company.


Reporting & Analysis:


	Track and analyze customer retention metrics (e.g., repeat business, satisfaction levels, churn rates) to measure the success of retention strategies.
	Prepare and present retention reports to management, highlighting key findings and opportunities for improvement.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: jointheteam@orikigroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
